title.narrative: A Comprehensive Counter Trafficking Program to Address Human Trafficking in Bangladesh

description.narrative: The overall objective of this project is to enhance the institutional response to counter-trafficking in persons in Bangladesh and promote accountable and effective governance mechanisms. The project will focus on enhancing the legal and judicial system to effectively identify, investigate and prosecute cases of human trafficking. It will also focus on developing victim-centered prevention and protection services to victims and survivors of trafficking by providing sustainable reintegration support to Cox's Bazar, Jashore, Satkhira, and Dhaka, and by raising public awareness on forced labour, modern slavery, human trafficking, and safe migration. The project will also assist vulnerable communities affected by the COVID-19 outbreak in Bangladesh. IOM has developed a preparedness and response plan identifying interventions in line with the IOM Global Appeal, the ISCG Activity Prioritization Strategy and the Government of Bangladesh's National Preparedness and Response Plan (NPRP). On 18 May 2020, KOICA approached IOM and advised that USD 400,000 could be reallocated to IOM's COVID-19 response activities for seven months (June to December 2020), notably to fund the Rohingya Humanitarian Response Plan in Cox's Bazar and to strengthen the capacity of Points of Entry (POE) of Bangladesh to enhance capacity of beneficiary and co-beneficiary agencies for responding COVID 19 together with supporting stranded migrants and vulnerable groups including returnees. The realigned funding will be used to support protection and livelihoods activities for Rohingya refugees in Cox's Bazar and to complement ongoing efforts to strengthen the capacity of eight POEs. At POEs, activities will include strengthening of technical infrastructure, improving intra and inter-agency coordination, supporting vulnerable migrants with Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and other essential items, and enhancing awareness-raising on COVID-19.
